column4: is there a way i can monitor what's uploading and downloading from my pc?
is there a way i can monitor what's uploading and downloading from ubuntu 9.10?
several ..
conky shows activity, netstat shows connections.. be more specific
i've found system monitor shows current upload and downloads - i'd like to see what programs are uploading and downloading
ty friend
anything like darkstat with a gui?
: darkstat in a browser ?!
huh? i installed through synaptic but can only seem to be about to launch a text interface from terminal typing darkstat..
it's some time ago I used it, if I remember right, it creates a server can be called in browser, showing diffrented graphs
trafshow is another possibility for detailed view, though less fancy in graphical way then darkstat
are you saying i should see a gui in darkstat?
I used it on my router once, and I could call a gui in my browser, yes
you mean in firefox? how?
it acts as a server, and you can configure it's address and port
complicated
i just want a simple gui of incoming and out going traffic
without seperation what the traffic consists of ? conky or systemmonitor for panel then
system monitor doesn't show what programs are generating the traffic etc, i'll try confy. thanks
as said, simple graphs don't allow seperation
either use something like ethereal or trafshow (no GUI") , or just have a overview for bandwith
ty
